newsitem.title: ITALY: BCI cuts prime rate to 9.0 pct, top unch.
newsitem.headline: BCI cuts prime rate to 9.0 pct, top unch.

text.p: Banca Commerciale Italiana (BCI) on Monday reduced its prime lending rate to 9.0 percent from 9.50 percent, effective from July 1, aligning it with other Italian retail banks.
The move follows a 50 basis point cut in official rates by the Bank of Italy, effective Monday, which reduced the discount rate to 6.25 percent and fixed terms advances to 7.75 percent.
BCI said in a statement the bank's top lending rate remained unchanged at 16 percent, but said it was studying a possible reduction in customer deposit rates.
Other Italian banks, including San Paolo di Torino, already have prime rates at 9.0 percent or below having cut earlier in the year after the last Bank of Italy rate move in January.
Popolare Novara and Banca Sella have prime rates at 8.75 percent.
